reviews.review_msg: Dr. Arab is great! She chose really interesting plays for us to study and every lecture approached the key themes from cool perspectives. Grading is done by your TA so it depends (my TA, Felix, was awesome! Assignments aren't awful, since the prompts are stuff that we focus on in class. Overall, great course!

Dr. Arab is underrated on here. She's awesome! Really interesting way of approaching the texts and analyzes them in a way that engages you the whole lecture! She chose great plays for us to study and lectures are really thought provoking. Assignments are what you'd expect from an english class, few papers but interesting topics! Love her!

Professor Flagel is not a bad prof. but, the course material can be quite boring. If you are not interested in 20th century British plays I recommend not taking Engl 113W and taking another 1st year English class.

I honestly dont get all the mean comments on here. Dr. Flagel is an excellent prof: she is professional, gives breaks, adds a personal touch, her lectures are fun, her tutorials are awesome/fun, and her one-on-one office hours are invaluable! If you are willing to put in the work you will do really well and learn important skills for the future.

Lectures are extremely boring and not useful at all. She cracks jokes that only she laughs at. Assignments are unclear. Not too many readings as we read 5 plays throughout the course which take about 2 hours each. All things considered, I would not recommend taking this class unless you are very interested in drama and are a good writer.

Dr. Budra's interest in theatre is extremely visible throughout his lecture. He takes lots of time to clearly explain the material we cover in the course, and provides detailed feedback on papers. Dr. Budra made his lectures entertaining, and every easy to pay attention to. This is the first English class that I have truly been interested in.
His lectures are really fun and engaging and his passion for theatre makes it even better. Answered any questions thoroughly and was always available through email/office hours.
i hate english and i took this because i needed it but this lowkey had me loving theatre

Paul was very engaging during lectures, but you he didn't post his lecture notes online, which basically gave you very bit of info needed for each play you read, so you can't skip class. The 2 papers to be written catered to both the creative and analytical thinkers. His final was very fare and was open book.

I'm not really into English and literature, but Paul made his lectures really interesting and fun! He cares about his students and he is also available to answer questions outside of class time. Definitely, recommend this prof!

Tried too hard to be funny but comes off as condescending. Is accessible through his secretary and his own personal website that be plugs every 5 mins. Egotistical. No computers or electronics allowed whatsoever, all attention must be on him. Easy enough class if you can stand his personality

Diana is an amazing professor who shows passion in what she teaches. Her lectures are very interesting and are a must, as most things learned in class are on the final. The TA's were amazing too, and the class had 2 essays and a final. The final was really easy, as Diana wants her students to succeed and get a good mark. I would recommend her!
